intro: Octomeria boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian octomeris, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Octomeria boliviensis is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
